meanings.definition: To board a ship or aircraft again.
meanings.sent1: After exploring the island, they had to reembark on the cruise ship.
meanings.sent2: Passengers were asked to reembark the plane due to a sudden change in weather.
meanings.sent3: The pirates forgot their treasure map on the island and had to reembark to retrieve it.
meanings.sent4: As the storm passed, the sailors reembarked their vessel to continue their journey.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to reembark the spaceship before the countdown reached zero.

meanings.definition: To load or put on board a ship or aircraft again.
meanings.sent1: The crew had to reembark the supplies that were left on the dock.
meanings.sent2: The workers rushed to reembark the cargo onto the waiting ship.
meanings.sent3: The captain realized they forgot to reembark the rescue equipment and had to turn back.
meanings.sent4: The team had to reembark the equipment quickly to avoid missing their flight.
meanings.sent5: The sailors had to reembark the rescued animals onto the ship for their safety.
